lines.content: *  Deadline task in the task list.
* Constructs a new deadline task with the given description and due date.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The due date in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* Constructs a new deadline task with the given description, due date, and completion status.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The due date in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* @param isDone true if the task is completed, otherwise false.
public Deadline(String description, String dueDate, boolean isDone) {
* Parses a date string in the format "yyyy-MM-dd" into a LocalDate object.
* @param dateStr The due date in string format.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task.
* The format includes the task type identifier [D], the completion status, task description,
* and the due date formatted as user readable format 'MMM dd yyyy' (e.g., Oct 15 2024).
* @return A string representing the deadline task.
* Returns a string for saving the deadline task to a file.
* @return A string for file storage in the format "D | 1 | description | yyyy-MM-dd".
* An event task in the task list.
* Constructs an Event task with the specified description and time period.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The time period of the event.
* Constructs an Event task with the specified description, time period, and completion status.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The time period of the event.
* @param isDone true if the task is completed, otherwise false.
public Event(String description, String from, boolean isDone) {

* The format includes the task type identifier [E], the completion status,
* the task description, and the time period.
* @return A string representing the event task.
* Returns a  string for saving the event task to a file.
* @return A string for file storage in the format "E | 1 | description | from".

* @return A string array of size 2: [command, argument].

* Deals with loading and saving tasks from/to a file.

* Reads and loads tasks from the storage file.

return tasks; // return empty if no existing file
* Writes the current list of tasks to the storage file.
* Each task is formatted and saved in a line-separated format.

* Returns the status icon representing whether the task is completed.

* Marks the task as done by setting the status to true.
* Unmarks the task as done by setting the status to false.

* Displays the tasks that match the search query.
* @param foundTasks List of tasks that match the search query.
System.out.println(" Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
"Deadline should reflect as done with X.");
Event event = new Event("Project meeting", "Aug 6th 2pm to 4pm");
assertEquals("[E][ ] Project meeting (from: Aug 6th 2pm to 4pm)", event.toString(),
"Event string representation should match expected format.");
Event event = new Event("Company retreat", "May 10th 10am to 5pm");
assertEquals("[E][X] Company retreat (from: May 10th 10am to 5pm)", event.toString(),
Event event = new Event("Team outing", "Dec 1st 9am to 6pm", true);
assertEquals("[E][ ] Team outing (from: Dec 1st 9am to 6pm)", event.toString(),
"Event should be unmarked and set to not done.");
Event event = new Event("Conference call", "Nov 20th 3pm to 5pm");
assertEquals("E | 0 | Conference call | Nov 20th 3pm to 5pm", event.toFileFormat(),
"Event file format should match expected output.");
Event event = new Event("Product launch", "Jan 15th 1pm to 3pm", true);
assertEquals("E | 1 | Product launch | Jan 15th 1pm to 3pm", event.toFileFormat(),
"Event file format should reflect done status.");
assertEquals(1, taskList.size(), "Task list should contain Finish homework task.");
assertEquals(0, taskList.size(), "Task list should be empty.");
Task task = new Task("Read a book");
assertEquals(task, taskList.getTask(0), "Retrieved task should be the same as added.");
"ToDo string representation should match expected format.");
ToDo todo = new ToDo("Buy groceries", true);
"ToDo should be unmarked and set to not done.");
ToDo todo = new ToDo("Go to gym");
"ToDo file format should match expected output.");
ToDo todo = new ToDo("Prepare for exam", true);
"ToDo file format should reflect done status.");
